availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
The State of Pennsylvania
County of Philadelphia } SS.

I Theodore M Morgan duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky resident at Philadelphia, in the State of Pennsylvania, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such Commissioner under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky.
Sworn and Subscribed before me, this thirty first day of October A D. 1862

figure.ab:
THEODORE M MORGAN
COMMISSION FOR OF
Kentucky
PHILADELPHIA, PA.

body.p:
Pennsylvania
Comr of Deeds
Oath
Theo. M. Morgan
Filed Nov. 4 1862
